extendedInfo.description: Prevention Information, published by HIT, on blood borne viruses.  Aimed at injecting drug users, this easy-to-read, highly visual leaflet gives the, how they are caught and how they can be passed on.  It gives advice on how to reduce the risks of contracting a blood borne virus, how to get tested and information on where and how to get further help and advice.HIT was established in 1985 to reduce drug-related harm and set up one of the worldâs first HIV prevention projects for people who use drugs. It is one of the leading agencies in the world dealing with education, information and training about legal and illegal drugs.
